title: Punjab’s drug menace: AAP blames Centre for failing to curb cross-border smuggling
content: The AAP said that despite the area up to 50 km along the international border being under the jurisdiction of the BSF, drug smuggling from across the border has not stopped

title: Will contest Bihar election under Nitish’s leadership but BJP parliamentary board will decide CM’s name, says Bihar BJP chief Dilip Jaiswal
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav says people won’t elect Nitish as he failed to develop Bihar despite being in power for 20 years; says JD(U) will collapse soon as most of its MLAs have entered into understanding with BJP

title: Mining revenue under Congress Govt set to grow by ₹120 crore, says Sukhu
content: During the BJP government’s tenure two years ago, the State government’s revenue from mining was ₹240 crore. However, due to the pragmatic efforts of our government, it increased to ₹314 crore in the last financial year, says CM Sukhu

title: Bulldozer action: Trinamool MP seeks Supreme Court intervention in Maharashtra case
content: Trinamool MP Saket Gokhale has alleged that a minor 15-year-old Muslim boy and his family were targeted as part of the “dirty communal politics of the BJP”

title: Greater Chennai Corporation to have 20 zones after reorganisation
content: The decision is aimed at resolving administrative challenges being faced by civic authorities in equitable distribution of resources

title: ‘Navu Manujaru’ has positively impacted students, finds DSERT report
content: The programme was launched in all government, aided and unaided primary and high schools in the State on June 24

title: Maharashtra govt collaborates with Meta to launch WhatsApp-based citizen services
content: The chatbot, ‘Aaple Sarkar’, will offer services like addressing grievances, downloading critical documents and certificates, convenience services like booking bus tickets via MSRTC or BEST and providing timely information to farmers and citizens across Maharashtra in Marathi, English, and Hindi.

title: Manage lifestyle to beat hypertension, urge doctors
content: Healthy diet, positive mindset, adequate sleep and exercise are all important, they said at webinar presented by The Hindu and Naruvi Hospital

title: BJP, Congress trade allegations as trial burning of Union Carbide waste begins
content: Madhya Pradesh Congress president Jitu Patwari alleges that the BJP has given ‘cancer’ to the future generations with the incineration of the 40-year-old toxic waste in Pithampur

title: Special focus on completion of Godavari-Banakacherla project, says Finance Minister Payyavula Keshav
content: ‘This project will transfer 200 tmc ft floodwater from the Godavari river to Banakacherla head regulator through a link canal and fulfil water demand in drought-prone Rayalaseema region’

title: Caste groups cannot claim exclusive right to administer temples, Madras High Court rules
content: The concept that a particular temple belongs to a particular caste is unacceptable. Segregation of temples on the basis of caste will only lead to perpetration of caste, says Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy

title: Telangana plans to introduce health tourism policy, says Chief Minister
content: The State government is planning to develop a dedicated health campus near the airport on a 1,000-acre site, A. Revanth Reddy announced at the felicitation of Padma Vibhushan award winner D. Nageshwar Reddy

title: Centre gives green light for Warangal airport
content: Minister Ram Mohan Naidu approves NOC for Mamnoor Airport expansion near Hyderabad, boosting regional development in Telangana

title: Deputy CM Bhatti invites EU chief to visit Telangana
content: “Telangana and our capital city of Hyderabad can be your perfect Gateway to India,” Bhatti tells EU chief

title: The contentious amendments to the Advocates Act and their implications
content: Amid widespread protests and strong opposition from the legal community, the Union government has withdrawn the Advocates (Amendment) Bill. What made the proposed amendments so contentious, and how do experts view them?

title: Struggles of tribal workers in tea plantations in Assam take centre stage at ITFoK
content: Chai Garam, a play by Orchid Theatre, sheds light on the exploitation and oppression faced by these communities under British colonial rule and their continuing struggle for survival

title: Naidu warns TDP MLAs and Ministers of YSRCP ‘political conspiracies’
content: Highlighting the murder case of former Kadapa MP Y.S. Vivekananda Reddy, the TDP chief says initially it it portrayed as a heart attack

title: Senior musicians criticise poor treatment of classical music at Hampi Utsav
content: The event, which began on Friday, has drawn criticism for its handling of classical music performances

title: UDF activists storm Wayanad collectorate, seek justice for landslide survivors
content: MLA says decisions are being made in the State capital without consulting those affected by the landslides

title: Mayiladuthurai Collector blames child victim for sexual assault, triggers outrage
content: The Collector, A.P. Mahabharathi, while speaking at a POCSO Act awareness programme, claimed that the girl had behaved “wrongly” by spitting on the boy, which may have led to the incident; hours after the speech he was transferred

title: Congress urges government to adopt bottom-up approach in policymaking to tackle low consumption and inequality
content: Congress general secretary (communications)  Jairam Ramesh says India’s per capita consumption expenditure is only ₹1,493 - less than a third of China’s - and the consumption of several key lifestyle goods such as two-wheelers, air conditioners and footwear is alarmingly low

title: CPI(M) does not rule out Pinarayi Vijayan heading a third prospective LDF government after 2026 Assembly polls
content: The CPI(M) has consented to waive the two-term limit for party members holding high public office, says Govindan

title: No one is above the country and its values: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar in Bengal
content: During his one-day visit to Bengal, the former Governor of the State hailed Kolkata as the epicentre of culture and highlighted West Bengal’s contributions to India’s history and culture

title: Tribal outfits protest for separate religion column
content: Protesters said their distinct religious identity was negated when the 2001 and 2011 Censuses forced them to mark their religion under the “Others” column

title: A conversation across generations to reveal Sri Lanka’s hidden history
content: Award-winning theatre director Ruwanthie de Chickera chronicles Sri Lanka’s post-colonial history, independence, revolts, 30-year civil war, and the post-war situation in her play

title: Murals at Ettumanur temple to regain original splendour, uniqueness
content: The conservation work is being carried out by the Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB) in collaboration with Vasthuvidya Gurukulam, Aranmula.

title: ED restitutes ₹2.29 crore to defrauded investors of Rose Valley Group
content: This is the fifth such payment in relation to this scam which had affected lakhs of people in West Bengal and other adjacent States

title: Indian digital economy ranked 28th on user spending: report
content: India’s digital economy growth outpaces overall economy, with potential for increased investments in digital penetration and innovation

title: KWML mulls extending Water Metro ferries to nearby districts; but tender to procure 15 Water Metro ferries not finalised
content: The extensions are in the proposal stage and would depend on the outcome of a feasibility study conducted by Kochi Metro Rail Ltd

title: Schools, salons, weavers and farmers in A.P. to get free power supply
content: SC and ST families will receive up to 200 units of free electricity per month for which ₹400 crore has been allocated in the State Budget

title: Trinamool moves privilege motion against External Affairs Minister
content: Motion relates to alleged ‘misleading and incomplete’ information given by Jaishankar regarding the deportation of Indians from the U.S.

title: 'Tired and retired': Has Nitish Kumar lost his bargaining power?
content: Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar is under opposition fire over the recent cabinet expansion. Critics argue that Nitish Kumar's dominance in Bihar's politics is waning as BJP takes a firmer grip, evident from the fact that all new ministers were from the BJP. Opposition leaders claim the BJP is using Nitish as a mask, while the JD(U) and BJP firmly rebut these allegations.

title: The Godfather in WH: Trump’s 'mafia-style' policy puts world on edge
content: Trump is changing US foreign policy by focusing on deals rather than alliances. His approach is transactional, viewing international relationships as business deals. This shift is causing concern among traditional allies and could undermine the global order established post-World War II. NATO and US influence may weaken, while adversaries like Russia and China see opportunities.

title: Washout secures Australia's spot in Champions Trophy semi-final
content: Australia advanced to the Champions Trophy semifinals after their rain-hit match against Afghanistan was abandoned. Chasing 274, Australia were 109 for 1 when the game was called off. Travis Head was in fine form with 59 runs. Afghanistan's hopes hinge on the South Africa-England match outcome, with net run-rate calculations potentially deciding their fate.

title: 'No idea ... but I can tell you': Zerodha's Nithin Kamath as Sensex falls
content: Indian stock markets experienced a significant decline in February, with Sensex dropping over 4,000 points, leading to a Rs 40 lakh crore erosion in market capitalization. The Nifty 50 encountered its longest losing streak since 1996. Experts see this as a mostly technical correction, potentially leading to a future rebound.

title: Ukraine will have to make 'compromises' in Russia truce: Trump
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with U.S. President Donald Trump at the White House to discuss post-war reconstruction and security commitments. The visit aims to solidify economic cooperation and ensure future protection against potential Russian aggression.

title: Bitcoin Crashing: Robert Kiyosaki backs Elon Musk’s US bankruptcy warning
content: Renowned businessman Robert Kiyosaki supports Elon Musk's warnings about America's looming bankruptcy, citing systemic issues with the monetary system. Kiyosaki blamed rising debt and the potential collapse of the bond market for economic destabilization. He reaffirmed his faith in Bitcoin, Gold, and Silver as reliable investments during economic downturns, contrasting them with 'Fake Money.'

title: Sensex ends over 1,400 points down: 5 reasons for bloodbath on D-Street
content: Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, crashed in trade on Friday. While BSE Sensex went below 73,3200, Nifty50 was below 22,150.

title: 'Will not be able to give salaries for Feb’: Technicolor India head
content: Technicolor, a notable VFX and animation company, is shutting down its U.S. operations, impacting thousands of employees, particularly in India. Employees have not received their February salaries, and the situation remains uncertain as the company struggles financially and operationally to sustain its workforce and projects.

title: India sees 'highest growth in 12 years' in FY24 - top 10 points
content: India's real GDP grew by 6.2% in Q3 FY 2024-25, with nominal GDP rising by 9.9%. The fiscal year is projected to see a 6.5% real GDP growth. Agriculture outperformed other sectors, while mining and manufacturing lagged. Private consumption is set to expand by 7.6% in 2024-25.

title: 'Not trying to compete with Rishabh Pant': Rahul
content: KL Rahul, discussing India's mindset for the Champions Trophy clash against New Zealand, highlighted the team's focus on staying present and not relying on past performances. Rahul addressed his competition with Rishabh Pant for the wicketkeeper role, stressing his intent to play his game. He also addressed criticism about his strike rate, emphasizing team needs over personal metrics.

title: Delhi's healthcare: 10 glaring shortcomings identified by CAG
content: The recent CAG audit report highlights significant problems in Delhi's healthcare system, including staff shortages, infrastructure issues, and financial mismanagement. Additionally, essential medicines and regulatory compliance are lacking, severely impacting patient care and hospital operations.

title: Body language expert decodes Trump-Starmer meeting
content: United Kingdom Prime Minister Keir Starmer met US President Donald Trump at the White House to discuss US-UK relations. Body language expert Caroline Goyder highlighted the evident contrast between Trump's relaxed demeanor and Starmer's nervous gestures. Starmer faced the pressure of this significant political moment.

title: 'Sell a kidney if you must, but keep the Bitcoin'
content: Michael Saylor's provocative remark urging people to 'sell a kidney' to keep their Bitcoin amidst its steep decline has drawn criticism and disbelief. Analysts now question Bitcoin’s resilience as its speculative bubble appears to deflate, highlighting Saylor's controversial advocacy.

title: No concerns over Rohit, Shami's fitness: KL Rahul
content: KL Rahul has dismissed fitness concerns around Rohit Sharma and Mohammed Shami as India prepare for their crucial match against New Zealand. Despite some injury scares during their recent victory over Pakistan, the team looks confident and focused on securing a spot in the semifinals of the ICC Champions Trophy.

title: Ramadan Mubarak: Top 100 wishes, mgs, to share with your loved ones
content: Ramadan is a time for spiritual growth, reflection, and fostering connections with loved ones. The article encourages sharing heartfelt messages to spread joy, strengthen bonds, and promote peace during the holy month. Numerous sample messages are provided to inspire sending blessings and expressions of goodwill.

title: How did Pushpa 2 go from India to NBA halftime?
content: Pushpa 2: The Rule, starring Allu Arjun, made a global impact by featuring in the NBA halftime show with the song Peelings. The performance highlighted Indian cinema's growing reach. This exposure brings unprecedented international visibility to the Telugu film. The halftime show platform is a strategic move to build hype and engage a global audience.

title: Top cleric, 4 others killed in suicide bomb attack in Pakistan
content: A deadly blast at Darul Uloom Haqqania in Pakistan's Akkora Khattak district in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province killed at least five people and injured 20. Authorities linked the attack to Maulana Hamidul Haq Haqqani. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif condemned this act of terrorism and called for comprehensive measures against such threats.

title: Yograj slams Akram, Akhtar for hurling 'abuses at Pakistan for money'
content: Yograj Singh criticised retired Pakistani cricketers for prioritizing financial gains over nurturing young talent, contrasting them with Indian legends like Rahul Dravid and VVS Laxman who actively support India's youth cricket. Singh expressed willingness to coach Pakistan if approved and praised India's current form, predicting an India-New Zealand Champions Trophy final.

title: Beyond the headlines: What the first Epstein file reveals
content: To the public, Jeffrey Epstein was a financier, a man with wealth and high-profile friends. However, behind closed doors, he was far more—a manipulator who dealt not in money alone, but in secrets and leverage. His influence did not stem solely from his fortune but from the compromising material he allegedly collected on those in his orbit. As the Department of Justice released its first batch of unsealed court records, the world braced for what would come next.

title: Vatsal Sheth kisses Ishita Dutta's baby bump
content: Ishita Dutta and Vatsal Sheth are preparing to welcome their second child. On Friday, Ishita shared an adorable video on her Instagram Story featuring her husband, Vatsal. In the clip, she happily flaunts her baby bump, confirming the exciting news. Vatsal is seen sweetly hugging Ishita from behind, planting a loving kiss on her cheek and baby bump, making the moment even more heartwarming.

title: Pune rape case: Ligature mark found on accused's neck, cops suspect suicide bid
content: Pune police arrested Dattatray Ramdas Gade, accused of raping a woman inside a bus at Swargate bus station. A ligature mark was found on his neck, suggesting a suicide attempt. Gade, with prior criminal records, was traced and caught in a paddy field after a massive manhunt involving drones and canine units.

title: How UK PM used King Charles to entice Trump
content: Trump, visibly pleased, examined the letter, signed “Charles R” in a bold, striking script. “A beautiful man, a wonderful man,” he remarked, admiring the king’s signature before adding, “That’s quite a signature, isn’t it?” Starmer, playing the role of messenger, emphasized the historical nature of the invitation. “This is really special. This has never happened before,” he told reporters. Indeed, Trump became the first elected leader in modern history to receive two state visit invitations from Britain.

title: 'Longest digital arrest': Nainital prof trapped for 18 days
content: A 25-year-old man from Agra has been arrested for defrauding a Nainital professor of Rs 47 lakh using a digital house arrest scam. The longest known digital arrest in Uttarakhand, the victim was manipulated over 18 days, transferring funds under the scammer's threats.

title: 'Identify, deport illegal intruders': Amit Shah reviews Delhi law and order
content: Union home minister Amit Shah chaired a high-level meeting in Delhi, emphasizing expedited handling of 2020 riots cases, deportation of illegal immigrants, and boosting police accountability. He announced that construction approvals won't require police permission and directed actions against narcotics, interstate gangs, and support networks for illegal immigration. Safety measures for women, children, and traffic issues were also prioritized.

title: 'BJP will finish JD(U)': Tejashwi on why Nitish 's son should join politics
content: ​Tejashwi Yadav on Friday said he wants chief minister Nitish Kumar's son Nishant Kumar to join politics as soon as possible for the sake of the future of the JD(U). "He is our brother. I want him to join politics as soon as possible. Otherwise, the BJP will finish the JD(U), the party that was formed by Sharad Yadav," Tejashwi said.

title: Sanjay Bhandari wins appeal against extradition to India
content: ​​Defence middleman Sanjay Bhandari has won his appeal against extradition to India and has been discharged by the London High Court. The 62-year-old Indian national appealed against the decision to extradite him in December saying that he could face violence and extortion in Tihar jail if he was extradited to India.

title: Trudeau's biggest scandal? The 215 children's graves that were never found
content: In May 2021, Trudeau led the national mourning after reports emerged that the remains of 215 Indigenous children had been discovered in unmarked graves at the former Kamloops Indian Residential School. Trudeau ordered the Canadian flag to be flown at half-mast for nearly six months—the longest period in history—while politicians, activists, and the media rushed to label the finding as proof of Canada’s “genocide” against Indigenous peoples. Billions in taxpayer dollars were pledged for reconciliation efforts, and Canada’s global reputation took a hit.

title: Read: WWE elimination chamber 2025 preview and streaming details
content: The WWE Elimination Chamber event on March 1, 2025, in Toronto will feature thrilling matches, including The Rock's special challenge to Cody Rhodes, and the final appearances of stars like John Cena. Six men and six women will compete for title matches at WrestleMania 41. Travis Scott is expected to make a special appearance.

title: Rare celestial alignment of seven planets happening tonight, how to witness
content: Astronomy enthusiasts have a final opportunity to witness a rare seven-planet alignment on February 28, 2025, marking the culmination of a celestial event not to be seen again until 2040. To view this planetary parade, seek a pollution-free location with clear skies, and consider using binoculars or a telescope for Neptune and Uranus.

title: Rajiv Thakur reacts to Samay Raina's India's Got Latent controversy
content: Rajiv Thakur opens up about his bond with Samay Raina, crediting him for reigniting his stand-up comedy career and supporting his new vlog channel. Rajiv also reflects on the India's Got Latent controversy, emphasizing the importance of understanding one's audience and being prepared for the nature of the show. Thakur admires Samay's respect and love for fellow comedians.

title: The Trump family members named in Epstein list
content: The US Department of Justice released documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, revealing a contact list with high-profile names such as Ivana Trump and Mick Jagger. While flight logs and contact details were among the documents, the release did not provide new or significant revelations. The phase one release left observers wanting more substantial disclosures.

title: TCS manager Manav Sharma dies by suicide after wife 'harassment'
content: A 25-year-old Mumbai manager, Manav Sharma, committed suicide in Agra, alleging marital harassment. He recorded a distressing video before his death, expressing loneliness and pleading for awareness of men's struggles. Police are investigating the case after his family's complaint.

title: 'Don't discourage': Sindhu's father counters Gopichand's remark
content: P V Ramana, former Asian Games bronze-medalist in volleyball and father of badminton star P V Sindhu, emphasizes the balance between sports and academics for middle-class families, noting that sports open up many opportunities, including job prospects. He underlines the importance of trust in children's instincts and the role of coaches in guiding young athletes.

title: NBA: Curry’s new 3-point record leaves Damian, and Klay in dust
content: Stephen Curry's three-point shooting prowess sets him apart from others in the NBA. His recent performance against the Orlando Magic showcased his extraordinary skill, scoring 16 points in the second quarter alone, including a remarkable 49-foot shot. With 45 games featuring 9+ three-pointers, Curry has redefined the game, leaving competitors like Damian Lillard and Klay Thompson far behind.

title: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis receives threat message from Pakistani number
content: Mumbai Police have initiated an investigation following a WhatsApp threat from a Pakistani number to attack Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis. Meanwhile, two individuals were arrested for sending a bomb threat to Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde. Security measures have been intensified to ensure the safety of state officials.

title: 'In age of AI, forcing language unnecessary': Stalin intensifies attack against NEP
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin criticized the implementation of a three-language policy, advocating the use of Artificial Intelligence for translation instead of burdening students with additional languages. He emphasized innovation over linguistic imposition. Meanwhile, Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi supported the New Education Policy 2020, arguing it provides more opportunities for youth and allows them to choose languages.

title: Does'Chhaava' re-affirm that rooted in Indian culture stories are working?
content: Vicky Kaushal's 'Chhaava' excels at the box office, becoming his biggest hit. Experts attribute its success to the film's larger-than-life appeal and cultural resonance. They emphasise the return of audiences to cinemas for grand productions, which offer unique experiences not replicable on OTT platforms.

title: Inaccessible tribal hamlets in Jawadhu Hills to get mobile connectivity
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Stafford agrees to restructured deal with Rams
content: The Los Angeles Rams and Matthew Stafford have agreed to a restructured contract that keeps the quarterback in Los Angeles, the team announced Friday.

title: Sources: Giants talk possible addition of Rodgers
content: The Giants are including Aaron Rodgers in their search for a veteran quarterback, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Friday.

title: UNC GM confirms talks amid 'Hard Knocks' link
content: North Carolina football general manager Michael Lombardi acknowledged that the program is considering a behind-the-scenes look at the team amid a report that the Tar Heels could be the focus of HBO's "Offseason Hard Knocks."

title: QB Sanders confident success will repeat in NFL
content: Shedeur Sanders didn't tone down his overt displays of confidence at Jackson State or Colorado. Now, as the draft prospect continues his path to the NFL, there's no reason to expect him to modify that approach.

title: Short answer: Gabriel cites wins amid height Q's
content: Oregon quarterback Dillon Gabriel points to his years of winning when questioned about how his height might cap his ceiling in the NFL.

title: Bond says he'll break Worthy's combine record
content: Isaiah Bond predicted he will break fellow Longhorn Xavier Worthy's record 40-yard dash time at the NFL scouting combine.

title: Texas raises ticket prices as player costs go up
content: Texas will be raising football season ticket prices by $13 per game next season as the program, already one of the richest in the nation, tries to meet rising costs.

title: Pair of aces: Whitnell's round has 2 holes-in-one
content: Dale Whitnell made two holes-in-one in the same round at the South African Open, having entered the day worrying about just making the cut at the European tour event.

title: Bowling Green's Loeffler takes QB job with Eagles
content: Bowling Green coach Scot Loeffler is leaving the school after six seasons to become quarterbacks coach of the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: The Cavs ignored the calls to break up their All-Star backcourt, and it's paying off
content: Garland became the subject of trade rumors in the offseason after a broken jaw and death of his grandmother derailed his season.

title: Trump, Zelensky In Oval Office Shouting Match: "Make A Deal Or We Are Out"
content: Minutes into the meeting between US President Donald Trump and Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky, a verbal duel broke out between the two leaders.

title: Ukraine Will Have To Make "Compromises" In Russia Truce: Trump To Zelensky
content: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky met US President Donald Trump at the White House today, as both leaders discussed a minerals deal for the United States as part of negotiations of a possible truce to end the war in Ukraine.

title: "No Rift": Congress After Kerala Meeting Amid Shashi Tharoor Row
content: Signalling an end to the row over Thiruvanathapuram MP Shashi Tharoor's 'praise' for the CPI(M)-led Left Democratic Front government in Kerala, the state Congress unit has dismissed reports of a rift and asserted that the party is united.

title: 24 Workers Trapped After Massive Avalanche Near Badrinath, 11 Rescued
content: The incident took place near the border village of Mana, about five kilometres from the Badrinath temple.

title: "Please Think About Men": TCS Employee Kills Self, Blames Wife In Video
content: A techie from Uttar Pradesh's Agra died by suicide earlier this week, leaving behind a distressing video blaming his wife of one year.

title: As Trump Boasts "BRICS Is Dead", New De-Dollarisation Call Comes As A Jolt
content: The BRICS+ nations have chosen to ignore Donald Trump's threats and go ahead with exactly what it intends on doing - finding an alternative to the US dollar for global trade.

title: Rahul Gandhi targets Centre over vacancies in SC Commission
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Bracketology: Notre Dame didn't hold on to that 1-seed for long
content: The second top-16 reveal was irrelevant within hours of being announced: Notre Dame, Tennessee lost and dropped, benefitting South Carolina, Kentucky, respectively.

title: What it's like returning as the worst team in MLB -- when you share a ballpark with the best
content: Coming back from a 121-loss season is hard enough. The White Sox are doing it in the shadow of the reigning World Series champs.

title: NHL Power Rankings: Each team's fantasy hockey surprise of 2024-25
content: How many teams changed spots with games resuming after 4 Nations Face-Off? Plus, which players have been better or worse than expected?

title: Penn State, Utah, Europe? Options for NHL's next outdoor games
content: The league has gone off the board in the past -- Lake Tahoe, anyone? -- and is open to creative destinations.

title: Boehly dismisses Chelsea fan fury: Par for course
content: Chelsea co-owner Todd Boehly has responded to fan criticism over his stewardship of the club, dismissing concerns as "par for the course."

title: Mourinho gets 4-game ban for derby comments
content: Fenerbahce manager Jose Mourinho was handed a four-match ban and fined by the Turkish Football Federation (TFF) on Thursday following his comments about Turkish referees after a match at Istanbul rivals Galatasaray.

title: Klopp's Red Bull move mocked by parade float
content: Former Liverpool manager Jürgen Klopp will have his own float at the Rose Monday carnival parade in Mainz but it may not be to his liking.

title: LaLiga chief: Reported Man City for breaking rules
content: LaLiga president Javier Tebas has revealed that he reported Manchester City to the European Commission for allegedly manipulating their balance sheets.

title: Ghaziabad Woman Alleges Gang-Rape, Arrested After Claims Found False
content: A woman has been arrested in Ghaziabad for repeatedly levelling allegations of rape, gang-rape and kidnapping against her husband, who was earlier her live-in partner, and his friends. Police said her latest allegation was found to be false

title: Divider-Crossing, Wrong-Side Driving Cause 3-Bike Collision, 1 Killed
content: A series of unfortunate events led to three motorcycles colliding with each other in Bihar, killing one and critically injuring two others.

title: Donald Trump, Bill Clinton: Jeffrey Epstein's Flight Logs Revealed
content: The 200-page document also includes the list of evidence the government has gathered against Epstein, who died in jail in 2019.

title: Citigroup Credited $81 Trillion In Account Instead Of $280 By Mistake: Report
content: Citigroup accidentally credited an account with $81 trillion instead of $280 as it meant to before catching the error, the Financial Times reported.

title: Australia Enter Champions Trophy Semis After Afghanistan Game Washed Out
content: Afghanistan vs Australia Highlights, Champions Trophy 2025: As Australia made it to the semi-finals, Afghanistan are left with just an outside chance.

title: Gray: UEL 'golden' chance to end Spurs drought

title: Newcastle's Howe says Isak injury not long term
content: Newcastle United boss Eddie Howe is unsure whether he will have his top scorer Alexander Isak available for Sunday's FA Cup fifth round match against Brighton, but is positive the striker is not facing a long layoff.

title: Mexico coach confirms talks with U.S.'s Ledezma

title: Iraq demands new venue for Palestine WCQ match

title: How bright is Man City's future? Assessing Guardiola's squad

title: Opinion: Champions Trophy: India Has Venue 'Advantage', But Whose Fault Is That?
